c74object.name: tap.biquadcalc
c74object.description: This object offers a way to generate filter coefficients for the biquad~ object. This is like what gets generated by filtergraph~ but without the added overhead of being a UI external.

method.name: bang
method.description: Calculate the coefficients and send them to the outlet.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The kind of filter algorithm to use. The options are: lowpass , highpass , bandpass , bandstop , peaknotch , lowshelf , highshelf , resonant , allpass"

attribute.name: cf
attribute.description: The center frequency or cutoff frequency of the filter."

attribute.name: gain
attribute.description: If applicable to the current filter type, this sets the gain of the filter in decibels.

attribute.name: sr
attribute.description: The sample rate used in performing the coefficient calculations. This is automatically set by MSP for the context provided to the object. If you wish to override this sample rate, then use the sr_override attribute.

attribute.name: sr_override
attribute.description: When defined, this attribute overrides the automatic sample-rate detection used for calculating the filter coefficients.

attribute.name: trigger
attribute.description: This flag determines when the coefficients are calculated. If set to none (0) then the coefficients are only calculated when a bang is received. 0=none, 1=cf, 2=gain, 3=q, -1=all
